sentences.en: As a result Heath rarely exhibited Nixon's crippling diffidence.
sentences.cn: 因此,希思很少表现出尼克松那种郁郁寡欢.

sentences.en: Diffidence is the poison of friendshellop.
He entered the room with a certain diffidence.
He has diffidence in expressing his opinions.
sentences.cn: 他表达意见时缺乏自信.

sentences.en: In Beijing, pride jostles with insecurity diffidence sits alongside brisk self - confidence .
sentences.cn: 在北京, 自豪感与不安全感交织在一起,刻意的谨慎与强烈的 自信 同时存在.

sentences.en: It is with diffidence and hesitation that I approach this work.
sentences.cn: 我是带著懦怯和犹豫接近这部作品的.

sentences.en: Mr Pen, besides other drawbacks, chose to entertain an extreme diffidence about himself.
sentences.cn: 潘先生, 除了其他缺点外, 对涉及他自己的事总是异常胆怯.

sentences.en: Mr. Cruncher, with some diffidence, explained himself as meaning'Old Nick's.'
sentences.cn: 克朗彻先生觉得有点扫兴, 解释说他指的是 “ 老撒旦 ”.

sentences.en: Such diffidence dates back a long time.
sentences.cn: 此类缺乏信心的情况由来已久.

sentences.en: The outer crust of her life, all of her natural diffidence and reserve, was torn away.
sentences.cn: 她的生活的外壳, 她的一切天生的羞怯和庄重, 全撕破了.

sentences.en: We set his silence down diffidence.
sentences.cn: 我们把他的沉默归之于缺乏自信.

sentences.en: We set his silence down to his diffidence.
sentences.cn: 我们把他的沉默归之于羞怯.

sentences.en: What women mistake as thoughtlessness is often just diffidence.
sentences.cn: 女性误以为是考虑不周的事情往往只是缺乏自信。

words.tran_cn: 羞怯的；缺乏自信的；谦虚谨慎的
缺乏自信地；踌躇地；羞怯地
